summary: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act authorized an average of $54.6 billion a year from FY 2022-2026 for the federal-aid highway program—the primary way the U.S. government invests in roads and bridges. The Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) distributes the funding to states. Our survey found that all 50 states, D.C., and Puerto Rico hired engineering consultants for various highway projects. State officials said consultants supplemented...
title: Federal-Aid Highways: Information on State Use and Oversight of Engineering Consultants
